text.p: Cameroon's Belgian coach Henri Depireux has quit in the middle of his team's bid to qualify for next year's World and African Nations Cup finals.
"There no longer exists any collaboration between me and my employers," Depireux said in a letter of resignation.
"Cameroonians don't adhere to my methods. For this and other reasons I have decided to abrogate my two-year contract with the soccer authorities."

The Indomitable Lions won many fans abroad for their thrilling performance in the 1990 World Cup when they reached the quarter-finals. They also qualified for the 1994 finals but failed to reach the last 16.
Critics of Depireux, appointed in Sepember 1996, say he has been unable to come up with a winning formula.
They drew 2-2 at home against Gabon in their last outing in the Nations Cup after enjoying a 2-0 lead.

No replacement has been named. Youth and Sports Ministry sources say five locally-based coaches would be appointed to steer the team through the final qualifying stages of the World and African Nations Cups.
